channel.title: StockHedges
channel.description: This is a randomly ordered feed of the most recent entries from StockHedges, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: For What Comes Next in Markets, Look Back to 2016
item.description: Selecting which Trump trades turn into Trump investments is just as difficult this time around as it was in his first term. The right bets might seem ...

item.title: Affirm beats on top and bottom lines
item.description: Affirm beats on earnings and revenue in fiscal first quarter.

item.title: Homeowners' Dues Are Rising---and Harder to Avoid
item.description: Rising costs for insurance, repair and maintenance are pushing HOA dues higher, often at a faster pace than overall inflation.

item.title: Europe's Economy Faces Sink-or-Swim Moment as Trump Returns
item.description: With the U.S. election result and the German government’s collapse, the lagging European economy is at a crossroads.

item.title: The Score: Warner Bros. Discovery, JPMorgan Chase, Sony and More Stocks That Defined the Week
item.description: Here are some of the major companies whose stocks moved on the week’s news.

item.title: The WSJ Dollar Index Rises 0.5% to 99.46
item.description: The WSJ Dollar Index was up 0.5% to 99.46 — up for two of the past three trading days.

item.title: Pinterest stock plunges following weak Q4 revenue guidance
item.description: Pinterest reported third-quarter earnings on Thursday that beat on the top and bottom lines.

item.title: Nissan shares plunge over 10% after downbeat quarterly results, production-cut plans
item.description: The automaker posted disappointing second-quarter results and announced reductions in production and staff.

item.title: Sony raises guidance on gaming strength, quarterly operating profit beats estimates
item.description: Sony raised sales guidance for the full year and posted operating profit that smashed analyst expectations after a strong quarter for its gaming busin...

item.title: Block reports revenue miss but a slight beat on earnings
item.description: Shares of Square parent Block tumbled in extended trading on Thursday after the company reported disappointing revenue for the third quarter.
